title: (x) Lovely slab serif that looks beautiful in print not so hot on the web - Rosewood Fill {Florian}
content:
Any help much appreciated!

I'm a fan of Costa coffee and at the moment think they are spot on in their promotion and look and feel. Even if the imagery is a little 'Pret' styled. 7 out of 10 for kARMARAMA

Use of this typeface is what makes it for me..

Find it here... [http://www.costa.co.uk/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202030628/http:/www.costa.co.uk/ "http://www.costa.co.uk/") (actually not so keen on appearance on screen)

best use is in printed media see [http://www.karmarama.com/casestudies/costa/default.aspx](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202030628/http:/www.karmarama.com/casestudies/costa/default.aspx "http://www.karmarama.com/casestudies/costa/default.aspx").

or see attached file.

If anyone can find it ..Thanks

David\_C

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 11.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202030628/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%2011_16.png) | 7.62 KB |
author: David_C

comments.content: Looks good used within 'MEN AND APES' event page on your site..

Thanks. Note that Rosewood is a chromatic font and has been designed to complement the Fill version, for two-color printing. (So is Pepperwood and Zebrawood, too.)  
Using it without its companion might be considered a bit, well, apish.

See this thread: [Is Rosewood Fill the new Comic Sans?](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202030628/http:/typophile.com/node/21280)

looks also like clarendon

In the spirit of unbridled creativity,

Troy Vera  
Kingdom Graphics  
 [http://www.kingdomgraphics.biz](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202030628/http:/www.kingdomgraphics.biz/ "http://www.kingdomgraphics.biz")
